com.erikartymiuk.badbudgetlogic.main

Class MoneyLoss

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.erikartymiuk.badbudgetlogic.main.MoneyLoss
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BudgetItem

    public class MoneyLoss
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a form of money loss. Money losses can be paid using cash or a credit card. A budget item is a type of loss but if it well be tracked it should be a member of the budgetItem class. This class is similar to a money gain object

    • Constructor Detail

      • MoneyLoss

        public MoneyLoss(java.lang.String expense,
                 double amount,
                 Frequency frequency,
                 java.util.Date nextLoss,
                 java.util.Date endDate,
                 Source source)
          throws BadBudgetInvalidValueException
        Constructor for a MoneyLoss object.
        Parameters:
        expense - - Description of the money loss ("Cable, Electric, Rent, Phone"), cannot be empty or null
        amount - - the amount of the loss, cannot be negative
        frequency - - how often to process this loss, if one time then end date must match next loss (unless next loss null)
        nextLoss - - The next date to process this loss (can only be null if freq one time indicating one time loss handled)
        endDate - - the last possible date this loss will be processed, if one time freq then must match next loss (unless next loss null)
        source - - the source to use as payment for this loss. Can be a cash account or a credit card, cannot be null
        Throws:
        BadBudgetInvalidValueException - - if the data contains errors

    • Method Detail

      • verifyValues

        public static int verifyValues(java.lang.String expense,
                               double amount,
                               Frequency frequency,
                               java.util.Date nextLoss,
                               java.util.Date endDate,
                               Source source)
        Error checking for values that will be used to create a money loss object. Returns an error code that corresponds to an error found or 0 if no errors are found. The following are the codes and a description of the error corresponding to it: 0 - Values are valid 1 - The expense string is not set or is empty 2 - The amount is negative 5 - Frequency is one time but end date is null 7 - Next loss is null but frequency is not one time (next loss null indicates one time payment already processed) 8 - Next loss not null and frequency one time but next loss doesn't match end date 6 - Source isn't set
        Parameters:
        expense - - Description of the money loss ("Cable, Electric, Rent, Phone"), cannot be empty or null
        amount - - the amount of the loss, cannot be negative
        frequency - - how often to process this loss, if one time then end date must match next loss (unless next loss null)
        nextLoss - - The date to next process this loss
        endDate - - the last possible date this loss will be processed, if one time freq then should match next loss date (unless nl null)
        source - - the source to use as payment for this loss. Can be a cash account or a credit card, cannot be null
        Returns:
        an error code corresponding to an error found or 0 if no errors were found

      • lossToday

        public boolean lossToday(java.util.Date date)
        Indicates if the nextLoss occurs on the given day.
        Returns:
        - true if the loss occurs on the same day (and year) as the given date, false otherwise

      • processLoss

        public void processLoss()
        Processes the next loss by removing amount from the source account. Calling method should first ensure that the loss is occurring on the day intended using the 'lossToday' method.

      • calculateNextLoss

        public java.util.Date calculateNextLoss(java.util.Date currLoss)
        Using the given loss date and the frequency of this object returns what the next loss date would be.
        Parameters:
        currLoss - - the date the last loss occurred to calculate off of for the next loss
        Returns:
        - the date of the next loss after the current next loss date

      • getPredictData

        public PredictDataMoneyLoss getPredictData(int dayIndex)
        Returns the PredictData at dayIndex for this loss
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - - the date as an index off the starting date in the prediction algorithm
        Returns:
        the predict data row at the given index (corresponds to the data on a specific date for this loss)

      • update

        public void update(int dayIndex)
        After running the prediction algorithm this method updates this loss's next withdrawal date to the value it would have on the day represented by day index.
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - - the day, as an offset from the start date used in the prediction algorithm, to update this losses values to.

      • updateNextDatesOnly

        public void updateNextDatesOnly(int dayIndex)
        Updates the next loss date for this loss.
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - - the day to update this loss to.
